name: Walid Jailani
biography: Walid Jailani is the President and Founder of the School of Freedom, an organization committed to empowering girls from underserved communities through education and women’s empowerment.
He recently graduated from the University of California, Davis, with a degree in Neurobiology, Physiology, and Behavior, and a minor in Education.
Walid's commitment to service extends far beyond his academic achievements. He volunteers at the Shifa Community Clinic and is a Nationally Certified EMT.
His efforts have been recognized with the California Region 3 Every Student Succeeding Award and the Presidential Medal of Volunteering.
Fluent in Farsi, Pashto, Dari, and English, he bridges cultural gaps and supports people from all backgrounds.

name: Robina Haqiqi
biography: Robina Haqiqi is a recent graduate from the University of California, Davis, where she earned her degree in Biological Sciences with a minor in Education.
Originally from Afghanistan, Robina is fluent in Dari, Farsi, Urdu, Hindi, and English.
Since 2021, she has worked as a dental assistant and is eager to pursue a career in dentistry.
She tutors Afghan girls whose education has been disrupted, helping them pursue their dreams.

name: Moheb Salemi
biography: My name is Moheb Salemi. I graduated in 2023 with a Bachelor’s degree in Economics from UC Davis.
I joined the School of Freedom to connect with my Afghan heritage and give back to those less fortunate.

name: Tayeeb Huda Jailani
biography: Tayeeb Huda Jailani is studying Computer Science and Engineering at UC Davis.
He has over three years of tutoring experience in math and English, and excels in AP courses.
As a former English language learner, he is empathetic to students’ struggles.
He is active in youth advocacy and works with the International Rescue Committee.
He also leads several student organizations promoting inclusivity and support for Muslim students.
In his personal time, he enjoys exercising and hopes to pursue a career in engineering.

name: Ghezal Karimi
biography: Ghezal Karimi is a recent UC Davis graduate with a degree in Psychology and Economics.
She is an incoming doctoral student in Clinical Psychology at Alliant International University.
Ghezal has actively contributed to mental health education and advocacy.
As an Afghan-American immigrant, she is passionate about giving back to her community.
Her work with the School of Freedom allows her to support Afghan girls in accessing education.

name: Omar Alhuniti
biography: Omar Alhuniti is the Outreach Coordinator at SOF, focusing on community engagement and trust.
He has experience in nonprofit work, student support, and building career bridges.
With Palestinian roots, Omar understands displacement and carries a deep sense of community resilience.
He studies at UC Davis and is pursuing a healthcare career centered on compassion and accountability.

name: Mariam Saleh
biography: Mariam Saleh recently graduated from UC Davis with a degree in Neurobiology, Physiology, and Behavior, and a minor in Education.
Fluent in Arabic and English, she is passionate about connecting with diverse communities.
She has worked as a dental assistant for nearly three years and has tutored since high school.
Her work with School of Freedom helps Afghan girls pursue their dreams despite challenges.

name: Jasmine Alhuniti
biography: Jasmine Alhuniti is the Finance Coordinator at School of Freedom.
She manages resources to ensure program sustainability and transparency.
With Palestinian roots, Jasmine is committed to empowering marginalized communities through education.
She ensures financial systems align to support Afghan girls’ futures.

name: Masoud Rahman Mahmoodi
biography: Masoud is a former third-year Computer Science student at Kabul University with experience in programming and web development.
He currently works as a Math Instructor at Willow Way and as a Full-Stack Developer at The School of Freedom.
He developed the organization’s website and upholds modern design and usability standards.
Now based in the United States, Masoud plans to continue his studies at a University of California campus.
His interests include software engineering, algorithms, and emerging technologies.
